informal_statement: Define the rank generating polynomial of a finite ℕ-graded poset as rankGenPoly := ∑ k in (Finset.univ.image (grade ℕ)), (Finset.univ.filter (fun x => grade ℕ x = k)).card • (Polynomial.X ^ k). Then prove that evaluating this polynomial at 1 gives the total cardinality: Polynomial.eval 1 rankGenPoly = Fintype.card α. The proof should use Polynomial.eval_finset_sum and Polynomial.eval_smul plus the fact that summing level cardinalities gives total cardinality.
suggested_signature:
noncomputable def rankGenPoly (α : Type*) [Fintype α] [DecidableEq α] [Preorder α] [GradeOrder ℕ α] : Polynomial ℕ := ∑ k in (Finset.univ : Finset α).image (grade ℕ), (Finset.univ.filter (fun x : α => grade ℕ x = k)).card • (Polynomial.X ^ k)

theorem rankGenPoly_eval_one (α : Type*) [Fintype α] [DecidableEq α] [Preorder α] [GradeOrder ℕ α] : Polynomial.eval 1 (rankGenPoly α) = Fintype.card α
hints: Define rankGenPoly first, then prove eval_one. Unfold rankGenPoly, use Polynomial.eval_finset_sum to push eval inside the sum, then use Polynomial.eval_smul and Polynomial.eval_pow plus Polynomial.eval_X to simplify each term to (filter card) * 1^k = filter card. Then the sum of filter cards equals Fintype.card α by Finset.card_eq_sum_card_image. Work over Polynomial ℕ (natural number coefficients) to avoid coercion issues.
